author: John Cross
title: West Ham close to Dimitri Payet transfer compromise so they can complete £25million double swoop
text:
Sport West Ham close to Dimitri Payet transfer compromise so they can complete £25million double swoop Stand-off with Marseille over wantaway star may end in time to spend his fee on Robert Snodgrass and Scott Hogan Share West Ham are believed to be softening five days before being stuck with Payet until summer (Photo: Getty) Share   Thank you for subscribing!   
West Ham could be ready to crack in the Dimitri Payet transfer saga as the winter window enters the final straight. 
Their position is believed to be softening as they look to try and get a £10million deal done for Hull’s Robert Snodgrass . 
The Hammers could also go back for Brentford striker Scott Hogan before the Tuesday night deadline. 
Marseille have already had a £22m offer including another £3m in add-ons for wantaway Payet turned down, but it is believed West Ham may be willing to take around £30m. West Ham are one of several clubs trying to land Snodgrass... (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) ...and also have their eye on Championship hot-shot Hogan (Photo: getwestLondon) 
They know the France international midfielder is desperate to leave and does not want to play for them again so they may have no option but to cut their losses. 
West Ham had been determined to hold out for £35m, but there has been no auction to force the price up as Payet has made it clear he only wants to go back to Marseille, his previous club. 
Marseille have asked about a loan with a fixed-price option to buy, but West Ham would be reluctant to agree to such a deal. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
